website_summaries.verdict: A terrific range hood that will work consistently in an ADA-compliant application.
pros: Mitered sides and hemmed bottom deliver the perfect blend of safety and style
Removable combination grease-charcoal filter provides clean indoor exhaust recirculation
One of the most economical duct-free range hoods on the market today
cons: Installs as non-ducted only with charcoal filter
Light suction into the fan housing

customer_reviews.title: I would have liked to have one that is vented to the outside ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this hood for a full kitchen remodel. I would have liked to have one that is vented to the outside but due to the kitchen design, it would have been expensive and would have resulted the project not being a do it yourself job. The installation was easy. Any experienced do-it-yourselfer should not have any issues with the installation. The shipping was super fast! As far as the performance, the fan does a great job of moving air and filtering it. It prevents the steam from escaping all over the kitchen and does a decent job of filtering out odors, however, not as well as a fan that is vented externally but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Càdrig

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly. Looks nice. Works well
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice for the price and was easy to install with zero experience in under 30 min.
customer_reviews.author: aleks y.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a kitchen remodel since I was building out floating shelves and Had no place to cleanly install a vent to the attic. Wiring was straight forward and my only complaint is that it was slightly bent during shipping causing the unit to be out of square. I was able to fix this myself so I did not contact the seller about it. This looks great in my newly remodeled kitchen
customer_reviews.author: dom gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Exact Replacement
customer_reviews.text: The removal of the old unit was fairly easy and the installation of the new unit, likewise, was easy. Don't forget to throw the circuit breaker to the range/range hood prior to removal. I love the quite motor on the exhaust fan.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Love my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Well needed. im so happy. If you intend to plug it in you must buy a cord kit sold separately. I don't think it sucks alot but i definitely see a difference. It doesn't make that much noise. On low you can barely hear it. Im happy so far with my purchase. I mounted mine without a cabinet or studs. I used anchors. It's pretty light. Downside the filter came damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Tyannti

customer_reviews.title: set your expectations accordingly and this is a decent hood
customer_reviews.text: This was almost an exact replacement for the one we got rid of. The suction isn't awesome but it works ok and the stainless looks very nice. Yes its very thin as others have stated. I'd been looking at other more powerful models or even upgrading to an externally vented model but in the end we just wanted to get rid of the original 1979 almond colored air vent. This unit bolted in using the same holes and parts and wiring and I was done in about 10 minutes. I give it a 4 because it's what I was expecting for this price range. Whenever we get around to redoing the kitchen this will not be what we use.
customer_reviews.author: SixtyFourTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL UNIT
customer_reviews.text: This unit looks fabulous in our new kitchen. We didn't have a range hood before, so this is a huge improvement. I did expect the fan to be more heavy-duty than it is, but it seems to keep cooking steam moving in the right direction. I expect this will cut down on grease buildup around and above the stove. Being a ductless model, the filter will filter out grease, protecting the fan, but will do nothing to remove cooking odors from the room. The light over the stove is fantastic. I used an LED bulb that uses less than 10W so I don't have to feel guilty about leaving it on as a night light.
customer_reviews.author: Ed S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Easy Kitchen Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace our 25 year old, worn out almond colored range hood. The stainless steel on this is very nice. The fan is quiet on both low and high speed, and can accommodate a very bright lightbulb. I wish it had a high and low setting for the light, but almost all hoods these days just have one brightness setting. Oh well. I will point out that this hood is meant to be direct wired into the house. My old one plugged into an outlet, so I had to buy a cord kit. No big deal, and everything went together smoothly. Made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R

customer_reviews.title: Broan 413001 ADA Non-Ducted Under-Cabinet Range Hood fan is weak.
customer_reviews.text: The power of the fan in the hood hardly pulls steam etc. if at all. Ours is placed 22 inches above the stove. It may work OK at 18 inches. It has a good light and is easy to install if one person holds it in place and the other marks where the screws need to go. It came without a grommet for where the wire enters the hood which cost around $2.00 and a trip to the hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: North Cascade Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Good Price, Looks Nice
customer_reviews.text: I've been repainting our kitchen and decided to replace the old, gross ductless range hood that didn't really match the appliances. This clean white looks great and fresh, arrived perfectly, no dents. Was a pretty easy swap and now the kitchen looks a lot brighter. Looks perfect with the yellow and white kitchen and matches the stove very nicely. I'm all about budget upgrades and this fit the bill for us.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great ductless range hood.
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to an older home that didn't have an existing range hood. As advertised it works. This is not ment to stick out over the 28 inches of depths of a typical stove/range. Build in rang hood are the same size so negitive reviews are BS. Was easy to install we added 1x4 support, due to how the cabinet was made that is over our range. Longer screws would have been a nicer fearure, but not a negitive comment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The Stainless Steel version!
customer_reviews.text: Update (08/24/2020): added a video to show the fan in operation, low at first, then to high, then back to low. Very quiet operation! Summary: Wife was very excited about the new range hood, stating "this new range hood greatly updated the look of our kitchen. It's very sleek looking, and the stainless steel will be a breeze to keep clean!" Included a picture of our old one for comparison. Pros: Stainless steel construction, low maintenance, high durability; all needed hardware included (except wire nuts); simple install. Cons: None. Conclusion: Recommend the low maintenance of the stainless version if that color will match your kitchen decor; your wife will thank you for the easy cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: aTypicalEngineer808

customer_reviews.title: It does NOT suck! :-o
customer_reviews.text: It's a good looking stove hood, though as I started cooking it was pulling about 1/3 of the smoke on high setting and the rest went into the room sadly. I thought it may be the filter, so I removed it and it wasn't much better if any. Finally there is really NO smoke removing technology other than possibly the filter, but unless it's able to pull in the smoke I can't know how effective it would be. Hope this is helpful, I'm doubtful anyone can find a quality hood with good suction anywhere in this price range. But I can't just keep throwing good money after bad etc.. good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Daxx

customer_reviews.title: "Economy" shouldn't mean "next to nonfunctional"...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't filter smoke or odors worth anything. "High" and "low" settings for the fan would be more accurate if they were renamed "LOL" and "ROFL". Yes, it's listed as the economy model, but I'm one person making single servings; it doesn't get much more "economy" than that. This fan suctions and filters so poorly that my smoke alarm went off three rooms away. "Economy" shouldn't mean "next to nonfunctional"; it should mean "hey, we understand you don't need anything fancy or superpowered or overpriced, so here's a quality, basic product that will work efficiently for one person on a budget". Unfortunately, that's not this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement hood
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace our old one after it caused an electrical fire (Lesson: Clean your hood regularly!). This time we opted for the non-vented hood as it was cheaper. If you cook a lot of food on super high heat that smokes a lot, this may not be the hood for you. It really sucks nothing up. Sure it makes noise like it is, and there's even a nice filter, but trust me, it doesn't suck the smoke out. For normal everyday cooking it's fine though. If you have the option to vent outside, do it. But if not then this hood is just fine. Doesn't come with a light so make sure you have one handy.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Perfect weekend project at a super low price.  EZ INSTALL!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our vent was old and not cleaning up so well after years of use. I bought this very inexpensive replacement and was blown away how easy it was to install. This was the first time I ever installed a vent and total replacement time was 50 minutes. Anybody with a screw driver and knows how to turn off a breaker can install this unit. Even the screws from the old unit matched perfectly with this one. SUPER EZ INSTALL!!!!! Unit looks great and the fan is so much quieter than our old one. I highly recommend! A+ BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for Microwave
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this ductless range hood insert after our over the range microwave broke. We didn't want the microwave above the stove any longer. This range hood was really easy to install. It took my husband about thirty minutes to install. He is by far not a handy man nor does he know how to install anything. He watched a YouTube video and was able to install this pretty quickly with no struggle. You will not be sorry with this range. It is a bit loud but not to loud that it is to much to take it. It had the same noise level as the one under our microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Looks SUPER ugly from a regular woman height and the fan is loud and weak
customer_reviews.text: YOU MUST KNOW THIS BEFORE YOU PURCHASE!! That you can see the whole ugly fan and the metal part from a position you cook!! My mom HATES this fan because you can literally see all the ugliness of the fan and all from her position. She is a regular woman height about 5'4"~5'6". Also, the fan is too weak for the low power and too loud for the high setting. I would not buy this if I were you. Spend more money and get a better and nicer looking on that doesn't show all the insides from under.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesky

customer_reviews.title: Happy House Wife
customer_reviews.text: Was shipped quickly, Everything was in the box, I did use different screws because I was attaching it to the bottom of upper cabinet, took me maybe 30 min. to install, nice and light weight. I am very pleased. When turned on the fan is neither quiet or loud just the sound of a fan running so that is fine. Light is fine for being over a stove. I got this stove hood because the fan switch on my jen air went out and I just couldn't see spending $$$ to replace just the switch. I would buy again and would recommend this hood.
customer_reviews.author: Pat S.

customer_reviews.title: Rusty and unusable
customer_reviews.text: Product came dirty and rusty in areas where metal is detailed or joined. No installation parts were in the box, not even a single screw. No wires/plugs are anywhere to be seen, so even if I had taken the time and my own equipment to get it set up, we wouldn't have been able to use it as it has no way to plug into a hidden outlet. Maybe this is a returned product, and the previous owner kept all parts aside from the hood itself? We ordered new, expected new. Got used, and unusable. Reviews were so promising, such a shame. :( Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Oddball

customer_reviews.title: Always check if instructions &parts are included. Or,if not, a list of these items is provided.
customer_reviews.text: The renovation went very slowly and the Broan hood was the last item to be installed. Unboxed it last week. Color spot on. However, it is still waiting to go up. No instructions. No bolts, nuts screws included. I’m not a contractor and have no idea what to buy. My mistake was in assuming appliances provided installation parts or give a list you could take to the hardware store. I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Hard to Fit

customer_reviews.title: Pretty for decoration
customer_reviews.text: 4 star for $40 aesthetic for the kitchen. Kinda sad it didnt come with anything to plug it in.. Gave 3 stars because it didnt even come with screws. Like, come on. But it is a pretty decorative piece.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Rees

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value, amazingly easy install
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for our original 20-year old range hood. It's actually almost identical except for being stainless steel. It's not as noisy as the original, and the installation was a snap - i did have to add flat washers as the screws were almost but not quite in the exact same spot as our old one. Under 20 minutes to install including the trip to the local hardware store for the washers. I'd recommend it if you don't need a vented hood.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking
customer_reviews.text: This is basically what I excpected from reading previous reviews. I knew it wasn't going to have the most suction or be the quietest but I mainly just wanted some functionality and the light. For my particular situation my cabinets are only 12" deep with a marble backsplash so only ended up with 11 1/2" actual depth. I couldn't get a nice powerful hood as all of those are too deep and would stick out way too far, this one fit my dimensions very well. It looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Take your measurements, and insure this product will fit. The advertised measurements fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great working a looking hood vent for your remodel or replacement. I would recommend using an LED light to give it a much more modern look, with better lighting and life than a standard bulb. Installation was a breeze, using my existing holes. IF your preexisting holes don't line up, just re drill a pilot hole with a size or two smaller than the screws you will use, then screw them into their new holes. Great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Q

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: Exact replacement for my old 30 inch range hood. My old one needed a new fan motor and the cheapest one I could find was $50. This range hood was twenty bucks cheaper it's white and looks better than the old white one it replaced. The only con I could come up with is my old range hood had two lights and this one only has one but since it's in the middle I really don't notice an lighting issues.
customer_reviews.author: Big Nate

customer_reviews.title: measure old vent well
customer_reviews.text: It came just like the description and pictures showed. I bought it to replace an old vent that neither the light or fan worked anymore. I made the mistake of only measuring how long my old vent was and not how low it hangs down the wall. That made hanging it a little more difficult, but not impossible by any means. Also, keep in mind that if your old vent plugs into an outlet the product doesn't come with a plug end (not that one is promised).
customer_reviews.author: D. Meininger

customer_reviews.title: Decent replacement
customer_reviews.text: The existing non-ducted hood was corroded, filthy and its fan and light switches had failed. This unit fit pretty well (some relocation of screws needed) and it works no better or worse than most non-ducted hoods. Expecting it to fully remove smoke and odors from the kitchen is unrealistic, but as a replacement for a hood that also was not vented to the outdoors, it is perfectly adequate and reasonably priced. Wiring is very simple. The metal cover for the wiring is especially flimsy and cheap, but other than some minor hassle lining it up once the hood was installed, that's not a serious issue.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: From look to measurements - from friendly installer (me) to light weight and great simple look. This is the perfect unit for small space. I need it for the basement kitchen and took me almost 2 years to find something like this and better yet, cost effective. The only thing I noticed is that is a little loud but the speed is good. Great item!!! PS: I a trying to upload a picture but it is not allowing it.
customer_reviews.author: €ari~β

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the price you would pay at a big store. If you have any basic knowledge of home electrical this is a snap. I had to drill a hole in the back of this unit so I could run my wiring through it. Once that was finished, I put a screw in each corner (4) and then hooked up the wiring. You will need to add a bulb for the light, I used an LED and it looks perfect. We are happy!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Cobb

customer_reviews.title: but I actually think it is working better as well so that's not really a negative
customer_reviews.text: Same size as my original one and matches my new appliances perfectly. Setup was a breeze. The light on this one is brighter and cooler (whiter) then the original one - It was more yellow (warmer). The fan is louder than my original one, but I actually think it is working better as well so that's not really a negative. The filter housing seems to be a breeze to take out when servicing as well. Bulb is easily accessible as well. All in all, good product and I was pleasantly surprised with price.
customer_reviews.author: hmr1979

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to install as I thought.
customer_reviews.text: The vent is a perfect fit for the cabinet it was installed under. After installing the spacer blocks as instructed, the screw key holes where too close to the edges of the vent. The screws lined up with the space between cabinet edge and the spacer. So it took a little more adjustment to get it installed. If the manufacture would move the key holes just a half inch to the center, the installation would be easier. Fortunately there were other pre-drilled holes to install additional screws to get a more secure installation. It's a good unit and give the space above the stove a finished look. As well as much needed light.
customer_reviews.author: RJB

customer_reviews.title: This make things really easy. Installed with one person and popped right in
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in a huge box, no padding...just a single, uncrumpled piece of brown paper, but no damage (box in a box). I was surprised that the range hood that I ordered, without actually looking at the old one which had not stopped working, we just changed appliance color black, that this is the exact same as the hood being replaced. The first was the original to the house built in the early 80's. This make things really easy. Installed with one person and popped right in. I hooked up the wires and away I went. Install took less than 1/2 hour.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Very easy install, nice unit!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy to install, just 4 screws. I had to put a bathmat on my oven, then a suitcase, then another 6-8" foam pillow to support it a bit while I pulled the wires through. If you have any experience wiring it will be a snap. Just be sure to turn off the circuit. If existing holes don't work for you, just drill another one through the metal. I noticed when I removed the old one that had been done. This is not ducted out, which is fine. Makes it even easier to install. I'm very happy, save me a trip to the big box store and I'm sure some money!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This product fit perfectly to replace a 25 year old range hood. As amateur installers it took 3 people to get this in. Two to hold up and one to screw into place. We also had to drill different holes into the top to fit the screw template from the the existing hood. That went well. There are knockout's on the top and rear for electrical. Works great. Fan is nice and the light works well. For the money this can't be topped.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: The suction is great on this. I can see the steam going right up. This is a basic model with 2 speeds but it works really well doing what it's supposed to. The light comes in handy. It's easy to clean. It was inexpensive but now that it's installed I wish I had selected a more expensive model where underneath is covered because we just redid our kitchen and I think a covered model would have looked better. But for the price.. this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: I don't use the fan;  the light is good and I guess it would protect the cabinets above if needed
customer_reviews.text: I like the color, I don't use the fan (no need), the light is good and I guess it would protect the cabinets above if needed. I went to a friend's house who has a very, very updated and fancy kitchen; and guess what? She has the same one! I really felt happy. The light, by the way, when you use a 60 watt bulb is wonderful. I think it is excellent so far, It is not yet a month, but I like it alot.
customer_reviews.author: Merritt G Claude

customer_reviews.title: Very nice replacement
customer_reviews.text: My old one was greasy and yellowed and for this price I wasn't going to go thru the work of cleaning and painting the old one. Had the same mounting holes and the wiring is simple. Perfect fit and look. I used a 100W led bulb so its nice and bright and works just fine. This one is non vented so the fan blows back toward you and up but not on you unless your 7" tall.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nathe

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far
customer_reviews.text: We like this so far. It was sort of a pain to install but that's just because of the way our cabinets were and how it was rigged for the giant microwave unit that this is replacing. It looks great and I'm excited to use it. One strange thing: maybe my over-the-stop microwave vent was abnormally loud or something but I was shocked that even on it's "high" setting, it's extremely quiet. Like it makes me wonder if something is faulty, it's that quiet. I will update after I use it if that's the case but if it works and "it's too quiet" is my worst complaint, then you can't really go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Smaller vent hood
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a smaller vent hood as my old one was 19 1/2 inches deep and seemed to get in my way when using the back burners. I noticed that this one was 17 1/2 inches deep so I purchased it. I was surprised to get it for under $40. I have been happy with this purchase as it does a good job of removing cooking heat and odors quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra H.

customer_reviews.title: Do not use without ducting!
customer_reviews.text: Although the Broan hood fan is well built and fits perfectly into my 30 inch space above my stove top, the fan is much weaker than I hoped (after nearly purchasing a hood fan with 700 cfm which my wife said was too expensive). All the hood fan does, non ducted, is blow the less greasy air through the three vents into the kitchen. Your breathing will be worse. I'm either going to return the hood fan or duct it and give it another chance. I'll let you know. I'm looking at duct work and roof vents right now.

customer_reviews.title: Fan is broken!! Had to replace.
customer_reviews.text: Just had an electrician install this for me finally. Welp. It's broken. The light works great, and if you listen VERY VERY carefully you can hear a little noise inside, like it's the motor.... but the fan doesnt work at all. Had to request a new one. Crossing my fingers this next one works right. Makes me upset.
customer_reviews.author: Adam and Melissa

customer_reviews.title: the fan is louder than expected and the suction is pathetic. Even on high the steam goes everywhere except ...
customer_reviews.text: The metal is really thin, the fan is louder than expected and the suction is pathetic. Even on high the steam goes everywhere except in the filter. If i hadn't spent so much time re modelling my kitchen i would have sent it back. At the time i bought extra filters too, so i'm stuck with this for a while. Looks good, apart from that....meh.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: arrived with a dent
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived with a dent in the front. Could not see it until I removed the "protective" covering. The shipping box was fine so the damage occurred prior. It fits and works just fine. Would give five starts if it did not arrive damaged. If you buy this make sure to remove all the covering right away. Do not wait (like you are supposed to) to remove it until you install the fan.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to complete my stainless steel kitchen appliance collection. It fits perfectly and was to easy to install. I used the wiring that was on my old unit to hook this one up. It looks great and works great too.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Blue

customer_reviews.title: nice little hood
customer_reviews.text: accurate dimensions so it installed in the space without a problem. I'm not sure how effective the fan/suction is because it's had very little use (it's been installed in a boat galley), but the light is in the right spot, and lights the stove top and the overall appearance is clean and neat..
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fit Like A Glove
customer_reviews.text: Replace one just like this one, only difference was the name on it and it is stainless steel. Mine exhausts out the back and the vent bracket on the old one lined up with the new one exactly. So I didn't need to buy that part extra. 10 minutes to change out minus wife cleaning in between.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Kiss

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: delivered as stated and packaging was intact,,,for the price this is a great buy ,,,nothing fancy just does the job,,,the instructions is why a 4 star on ease of installation,,they were a little confusing ,,,very quiet fan and nice light fixture ,,,would buy again if needed
customer_reviews.author: rpwjr45

customer_reviews.title: Usless.  Poor Engineering.
customer_reviews.text: This hood is poorly designed. The fan box is not constructed so as to direct the exhaust to the exhaust louvers. Instead, the air sucked in is reflected back into the fan itself, creating a back pressure which causes the fan to slow down. As a result most of the cooking steam escapes around the side of the hood rather than passing through the filter. I would estimate that maybe 10% of the steam actually makes it to the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Economy and not all stainless
customer_reviews.text: This hood is not all stainless - only the edges are stainless. The rest of the hood is painted black metal. Based on other reviews, I expected the hood to be better than what I received. The box states that this is an economy hood and the quality matches the description. The hood works fine, but I expected something of thicker metal. I could have gotten a similar economy hood locally for the same quality at a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: W. Chilson

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking replacement hood
customer_reviews.text: I needed a moderately priced replacement venting hood for our home. It was packaged well & all needed parts were included. It doesn't draw odors as well as one would hope, but again, not sure many that are non-ducted do. It's a contemporary, brushed stainless steel & looks really nice in place. Our install took a bit of time, but that was due to improper installation of our previous hood where the builder had cut corners, so it took some readjusting to properly mount this one. I would purchase this again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: WhimZy

customer_reviews.title: Super easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Granted I was replacing the hood, but still.. The time from taking out the old and completely installing the new couldn't have been 15 minutes... Nice looking.. It's a "chevy" not a "cadillac".. but i'm very happy with the product, the price and the ease of installation.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Cannaday

customer_reviews.title: Good clean looking budget unit
customer_reviews.text: It took like 10 minutes to install, actually took longer to remove the old unit. Has decent lighting and fan suction. Buttons are a little flimsy like moving around as if they are just clipped in. For the price though it is an excellent deal. You may have to get longer screws to install depending on how the mount area is set up (I did anyways).
customer_reviews.author: Jill Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory, no frills replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to replace since I used the existing mount screws of the Kenmore range hood I was replacing. It uses one standard A-type bulb. I put a basic LED Philips bulb and we'll see how long it lasts. This was for my home, but not my "forever" home, so I didn't feel the need for something extravagant (kind of a moot point when dealing with a ductless system).
customer_reviews.author: NudistWithSerenity

customer_reviews.title: We are very pleased with our new range hood
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with our new range hood. It arrived on time per the notification we received upon ordering. It was well packed and was exactly as described in the specifications and description. It is by no means an expensive unit but we feel it is well worth the price we paid. Installation was very straightforward and easy. This replaced a very old range hood and we find it is extremely quiet compared to our old unit. We definitely feel we got a quality product for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks don't make up for being easily overwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice. Easy to install with a second person to hold up while I screwed in. Could have also used a board or bucket if needed. However, it is easily overwhelmed by a simple boiling pot of water, and we've set off our fire alarm several times by cooking bacon. I'd recommend finding a more powerful one if you do a lot of cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice range hood for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice Range hood for the price. This fit perfectly into the 30" opening above my electric glass-top range. My husband first installed two 1" x 2" slats on the underside of the cabinets to give him a better attachment. Total installation took about 15 minutes. The two-speed fan is much quieter than the one on my old hood. The shipping box was well-packed; the hood arrived in perfect condition with protective plastic along the front leading edge. I got this to complete a low budget kitchen reboot with fresh paint and brushed steel hardware. I keep looking at it and thinking "I'm so glad I got that." Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lorijay

customer_reviews.title: Light Bulb Choice
customer_reviews.text: The range hood works ok for a ductless unit. My only complaint is I used a 60w incandescent bulb when I first installed it and the hood got really hot because of the thin sheet metal construction. I switched to an LED bulb and it's fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H

customer_reviews.title: Making the best of it.
customer_reviews.text: My complaint is that that the light is very bright since the shield does not come down far enough to block the light so it shines in my eyes. I added an extra piece of material covered in silver duct tape to extend it. I'm of average height so perhaps someone taller would not have a problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: daisy13

customer_reviews.title: Cost and looks, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I can purchase these through my workplace, but the cost is so much higher. I saved myself almost $20 by going through Amazon. I purchased a new stove recently and needed to upgrade my range hood, so figured might as well match the appliances. You can't go wrong with a Broan/Nutone product. This is is quiet and very easy to install, about 20 minutes max...unless you have no idea what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: ID I Am

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install  + Simple Controls A+
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and very simple controls. Opted to purchase the two-prong plug in cord instead of hard wiring, which made the assembly and installation a breeze since there was already an outlet in the overhead cabinet . Only caution, that plug in cord doesn't come with the unit and must be purchased separately.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Insuficient packaging and low product quality
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was insufficient for the low quality of the product. I ordered two and they both came with minor damage. The "welds" are very weak and separate with very little effort. I did not wire it to test for noise level or suction before I returned them, but the install was easy.
customer_reviews.author: B Thornton

customer_reviews.title: good value for the $
customer_reviews.text: For the price I can't complain! Quality unit and replaced my old one without any modifications to my cabinets which is what I was after. The fan isn't the most powerful and the switches are a little basic... But hey it says it's an economy unit. Overall good value for the $. If your looking for a stronger fan consider their next model up
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great. Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Easy install. There are complaints of no hardware in the box. And one that said there was no electrical cord in the box. The hardware and electrical wiring is in the wiring box next to the filter. No it doesn’t suck in a lot of air, but it is a ductless vent, so it won’t operate like one that has a duct system. Overall very happy with the price and looks great installed.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Clean bright appliance white. Bright light.
customer_reviews.text: $40 was worth it to get a pretty new fan hood and light without going thru the drama of removing to sand and repaint old one. Crisp bright white look. High/low fan not very strong but enough to disperse steam away from cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: MitzyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived with minor defect, and was also dented from poor protection in shipping box.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't even gotten the hood installed yet, but the package arrived well dented on a couple sides, and the hood inside reflects that damage in the form of dents in the thin and lightweight metal. Also, a minor defect in the interior is noted, where the metal was not flush to the sidewalk and displays a sharp edge, bumping it from the rear.
customer_reviews.author: MinnesotaLK

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for the house we are renting. The original was from the 70s and just stopped working entirely. This range is affordable, easy to install and does what we need! Which pleased our landlord when it came to reimbursing. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: slick
customer_reviews.text: Looks really nice over my stove. It was not hard to install. The material not that heavy. I found a bend on the left side after inspecting it, but Others can't tell unless they get right on top of it. Or if you run your hand over the front left conner. But since its up I choose not to return it (this time) I right in the muddle of renovations so you can image. If I had to take it down wait for return just to have the guy come back out. I just can't. But it does look great over the stove and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed in Purchase
customer_reviews.text: No starter bulb, no plug. Had to get our own cord to create plug. Finally found screws inside metal panel. No guide to mount there was no mount template. Very disappointed in purchase. Very Cheaply made. Filter is loosely made.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Fan is a bit weak. There's no path to run the wires.
customer_reviews.text: Ideally the wires come from the wall behind it or the cabinet above it. I didn't have either. So I had to run a wire from the bottom and into the unit, so it doesn't sit flush with the wall. It would have been nice that it had a little indentation to run the wire (either from to or bottom) into the back of the unit. But it's not designed to do that, I guess. I bent it a little to make room of the cable and called it a day. It's a rental unit, I don't wanna open the wall anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Alan L.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful & Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: This hood replaced a Broan unit after we purchased a stainless steel range. Installation couldn't have been much easier, as the screws from the previous hood mated with the screw holes in this range hood. Installation was a snap, it's apparently well-built and the fan is nice and quiet. I'm glad I went with this brand!
customer_reviews.author: CorkyMuldoon

customer_reviews.title: Fan suction is weak
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great...except for the fan suction. Even on high, it doesn't seem to work well at all. Not impressed with the fan at all. If you cook a lot of foods that smoke, expect to set off the smoke alarm on a regular basis. (note, this was set up as a ductless unit with the carbon filters)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great except I hit my head on it
customer_reviews.text: Great looks. Simple install. Seems to clean up well. Fan is strong enough. It is a simple unit, but it serves the purpose and price is right. Damned if I don't smash my head on it constantly but so far it has survives my repeated head butts. It isn't its fault, I keep monkeying with the stove cord and everytime I look up - sure enough there is the hood bashing me in the skull :)
customer_reviews.author: Roy Baty

customer_reviews.title: A Little Change Makes A Big Difference
customer_reviews.text: Why it took me so long to replace my old range exhaust, I don't know. This one is great as it's ductless. It works well and since I knew it didn't come with a light bulb I had one ready for post installation. When I walk in to my kitchen and see this new non ductred range hood I am quite happy. Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: P. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Confusing Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this product if you want it to come undamaged and with clear and helpful instructions. How hard is it to print out product specific instructions and send your unit with those? I have an instruction manual for three different hoods and oh fun story this thing shipped with no screws for installation. Still haven't installed it and probably won't now as like I said it came with nothing and bent.
customer_reviews.author: D. Joslyn

customer_reviews.title: It looks good and the light is nice to have above the ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work very well at removing cooking odors. It's ok at removing some cooking steam and particulates. It looks good and the light is nice to have above the cook top. If you do only light cooking this would be nice, but if you cook a lot of different things using a lot of different techniques I would suggest getting a more powerful range hood.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay Ryerson

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: I realize the ductless hood would not have near the suction power as a ducted one but this thing is pathetic. I boiled water and the steam went everywhere except into the vent. All this thing does is make noise and provide light. I would be ashamed to sell such a lousy product. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Patton

customer_reviews.title: Completely Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Can’t imagine why anyone would buy a more expensive model. Fit perfectly where the old one was. My handyman did the change out. If you do the change out yourself, there is some wiring, so it’s best to know what you’re doing with electrical connections.
customer_reviews.author: West Texan

customer_reviews.title: A couple of reviews mentioned this thing being "flimsy" but it sure feels sturdy to me
customer_reviews.text: This replaced the exact same model I've had in my house for 15+ years. The old one never gave me any problems just wanted a new one to match our stainless appliances. Installation was simple since I already had the screws in place from the old one--slid right in, then connected the wiring. Real simple. Quieter than my old one (and less greasy). Stainless finish looks quality. A couple of reviews mentioned this thing being "flimsy" but it sure feels sturdy to me. For the price I think you'd be hard pressed to find anything nicer and I've seen these online at major retailers for almost twice the cost so quite the bargain from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: turbomatic

customer_reviews.title: We he only useful thing is the light
customer_reviews.text: Does absolutely nothing!! Makes slight noise but the smell still travels all over the house. We he only useful thing is the light. But my husband already installed it and now he is too lazy to take it down and install another.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Super easy install
customer_reviews.text: We removed the old Broan fan that came with our house when we purchased it. My husband said no way that this new one would install right into the opening, since it was so old. Surprise, surprise ... this one slid right into place without having to make any modifications whatsoever. Sure, it's not the fanciest, but it serves our needs just fine and looks great. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy T

customer_reviews.title: Broan ductless
customer_reviews.text: Although it is not true ventilation, it does do a good job. It is slightly on the noisy side on high, but that is to be expected. Mine did not come with a power cord, so I had to make one and it works fine. This is perfect for over your cook stove if there is no easy way to vent it properly. The lampshade seemed to dim the light too much for me, so I removed it
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy, fits the space we had for it
customer_reviews.text: I was cautiously optimistic in ordering this product. We're updating the kitchen in our townhouse and are making the switch to stainless steel appliances. I didn't want to pay an arm and a leg for something that was going to stay in the townhouse rather than come with us when we moved, and this vent fits the bill. It's sturdy, fits the space we had for it, and the clean lines looks great. You might have to do some finagling with the screw holes, but we suspect it's because the previous vent was installed poorly rather than this product being designed improperly. This is definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: C&A Allen

customer_reviews.title: keep this in mind
customer_reviews.text: You cannot put this up by yourself. Trust me. You will need someone to hold a flashlight, or help hold it up, or both of these. It is very easy to install, if you have someone to help you. Great value for the money. Looks great with the new stove.
customer_reviews.author: E. Buhser

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price and what you're ordering this is exactly what you want. Not the heaviest/highest quality fan but the price point is right on target, it looks fine above my stainless and inhales enough of the smoke to stop my fire alarm from going off every few minutes. I would solidly recommend to anyone looking to replace/upgrade, but who also doesn't want to spend $200+ on an oven hood.
customer_reviews.author: Whoistcmt

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable
customer_reviews.text: This is an economical range hood. It was definitely worth the price and serviceable in light use areas. If you have a small space or heavy use, you might want to step in quality. But, for light use in a normal kitchen space, this unit works fine and the finish and presentation is good.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good range hood for the price
customer_reviews.text: For an economy range hood, this Broan is okay. The finish is decent and installation was simple. Broan is utilizing a fan with a decreased noise level from the older version this hood replaced...that's good, but the suction power of the fan leaves a lot to be desired. For an economy fan, however, good product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price, not great suction though.
customer_reviews.text: Suction is pretty terrible. Doesn't really do the job, but it's clean and fresh, unlike my 30 year old almond colored one. Needed something to match the new kitchen but i never really use the range hood anyways. Having said that, again, the suction is pretty awful. But for the price, wasn't expecting much at all so I'm not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S. Baskey

customer_reviews.title: I am a happy customer.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time buying a used item on Amazon and it looks brand new. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: A low cost unit that functions well.
customer_reviews.text: You can see readily that this is a low cost product. But it worked well. It also looks nice and the stainless steel seems to be of good quality. It replaced a rusted harvest gold one that was 38 years old. It has been installed over two years with no trouble. It was a pain to install. Both the electrical connection and the mounting were difficult but not impossible. Recommended for the cost conscious with skills. I gave it 4 stars because of the difficulty of the install. I mainly use it for the light.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Like a Model T Ford!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's very plain, very basic. And it doesn't cost a lot. And it works... perfectly. What more could you ask? Installation was a breeze: one wire nut to connect the white wires, and another to connect the black. Wrap the ground wire around the terminal screw and tighten it, and you're ready to mount the unit to the underside of the cabinet above your range. Screw in a light bulb and turn on the power-- you're done. Cheap, easy to install, and it runs like a pickleseeder... I like it.
customer_reviews.author: michael mcwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Don't think you need to spend more!
customer_reviews.text: Looked at spending about 5 times as much, but went with this model to keep cost down on total remodel. Install was easy, just had to drill pilot holes in each side of vent hood as not able to use above mount pre-drilled holes. The fan isn't super quiet, but neither is my house, and it's not too loud by any stretch. It works as intended, and if it ever breaks I'll have the happy little feeling of knowing I didn't spend too much on it.
customer_reviews.author: PMiller

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised for the price that it is actually good quality.. the reason I gave it a 4 star.. is that it would of been nice to include a cord to plug it in. Instead of doing a hard wire. I have a cord.. installed it worked good.. other reviews said that the fan is loud.. I didn't think so. The install took 2 of us .. if u have to install by yourself good luck.. I would recommend and buy again..
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: GREAT price, Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality product at a GREAT price. I purchased this from Amazon and I work for a big box home improvement store. This stainless steel finish was special order only at work. It would take 2 weeks to arrive. PLUS even with my employee discount, it was still more expensive than Amazon!!! So, I saved $10. buying at Amazon AND it was here in 2 DAYS!!! (Unlike my work that was at least 2 weeks, maybe more)
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Looks cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mother. After going to her house late, I noticed that she had not installed it. She said that it looked "cheap" and she would like to return it. It has been over the 30 days so I was unable to. Not sure how the product functions, as it was never installed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Exactly
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly like the one that was already installed which was over 20 years old. It was still working but it became looking terrible on the upper outside so I wanted to replace it. This unit has been good to me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Really like this. I tried others but they stuck out too far and filters were expensive. This one is just right. Kinda looks dated because it's the same as the one we replaced that was 20 years one in white but it is quiet and functional ductless. This stainless matches the stainless appliances well
customer_reviews.author: Prime For Life

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy install.
customer_reviews.text: We were going to degrease and paint our old hood, but when I saw the price of this new one it was cheaper to just replace it. Installation was simply connecting three wires (white, black and green) and screwing in place. It took about 15 minutes to remove the old one and install the new one.
customer_reviews.author: flakeys2005

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: Went up fairly easy as we were just replacing an old one we had already. All the holes matched up. It is quiet. It was delivered very quickly and matched our new stove.
customer_reviews.author: Jonee Luke

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Night this to replace my 21 year old fan. I like how much quieter this is than the older model. It was also easy to install. Now I just need to paint the cabinets. 😁
customer_reviews.author: PLS

product_meta.title: Broan-NuTone 413004 Stainless Steel Ductless Range Hood Insert with Light Exhaust Fan for Under Cabinet, 30-Inch
product_meta.description:
Color:Stainless Steel| Size:30-Inch| Pattern Name:Range HoodUpgrade your kitchen with the Broan Ductless Range Hood Insert and Incandescent Light! This versatile insert is the perfect solution to your ventilation needs serving as both an exhaust fan and overhead light for your stove. The stainless steel unit is designed to fit neatly underneath your cabinets to provide quality airflow in your kitchen. It installs as a non-ducted range hood with a charcoal filter that effectively removes smoke and odors from your cook space. The protective lamp lens distributes light evenly over the cooktop and accepts up to 75W bulb (not included). It's designed with smooth surfaces that clean easily and quick-release filters that can go in the dishwasher. Install the insert at least 18" above cook top. The sides are mitered and the bottom edge hemmed, with no sharp edges for safety and good looks. The unit has a two-speed fan switch and separate light switch and the motor is permanently lubricated. For your convenience, this range hood can work in an ADA-compliant application and includes a 1 year limited warranty. Enhance your home today with the Broan Ductless Range Hood Insert and Light!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Broan 413004 Economy 30-Inch Two-Speed Non-Ducted Range Hood is Broan's most economical duct-free hood with the exclusive Microtek system for filtration of airborne cooling contaminants. Installs as non-ducted only with charcoal filter. Accepts up to 75 watt light (bulb sold separately). Made of stainless steel.
feature_bullets: HIGH-QUALITY DUCTLESS RANGE HOOD INSERT: Stainless steel hood insert improves ventilation and lighting over your stove with the non-ducted filtration system that effectively removes smoke and odors
EFFECTIVE INCANDESCENT LIGHTING: A protective lamp lens distributes light evenly over the cook-top and accepts up to 75W bulb (bulb not included)
EASY CARE: Charcoal filter is replaceable so you can maintain optimum grease capture and keep the kitchen fresh
VERSATILE: Separate rocker switches control the light and the 2-speed fan for easy use. Bulb (Recommended Type) - A19
IDEAL SIZE: Range hood insert measures 30" and should be installed at least 18" above cook top
Minimum Height Above Cook Top: 18 inches
Rocker-type fan and light control; 2-Speed fan
Non-ducted filter - effective non-ducted filtration system removes smoke and odors

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,548 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
